channel.title: Big O Theory Club
channel.description: Thoughts on theoretical computer science and research life.

item.title: Introduction to Computer Vision Workshop
item.description:
We had our second meeting on Tuesday this week because of Labor Day, and instead of a talk, we had a workshop in preparation for the Home Depot Deep Learning Hackathon. Arvind gave an introduction to the field of computer vision along with a simple Keras demo on the MNIST dataset. Slides for the workshop are here, and the code is here.

The Agency, GTâ€™s Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning club, ran a follow-up workshop on Generative Adversarial Networks, an advanced network architecture used in many state-of-the-art computer vision models today. The slides for that are here.

More information about the Deep Learning Hackathon, which is jointly run by us and the Agency can be found here.

item.title: Big O Fall 2018 First Meeting
item.description: Welcome to Big O: Theory Club! We had our first meeting where we introduced officers explained what Theory Club is all about. We also had a short problem session which you can find here, along with the other slides.

item.title: Big O Officer Elections
item.description:
Officer elections for next school year will be held on April 23rd. If you are interested in becoming an officer, fill our the following form:

item.title: Easter Problem Session by Shyamal Patel
Markov Chain Monte Carlo Methods Talk by Sherry Sarkar
item.description:
We had a talk on Monte Carlo Methods using Markov Chains by Sherry this week!

Slides are available here: Slides.

item.title: Neural Network Complexity Talk by Santosh Vempala
item.description:
We had a talk on Neural Network Complexity by professor Santosh Vempala this week!

The video recording of the talk is here: Video.

item.title: Zero Knowledge Proofs Problem Session by Sherry Sarkar
item.description:
We had a problem session on zero knowledge proofs by Sherry this week!

Slides are available here: Slides.

item.title: Catalan Shuffles Talk by Prasad Tetali
item.description:
We had a talk on Catalan Shuffles by professor Prasad Tetali this week!

His website is here: Website.

item.title: Derandomization Talk by Shyamal Patel
item.description:
We had a talk on derandomization by our workshop coordinator Shyamal!

Notes are available here: Notes.

item.title: Silly Talks
item.description:
We had silly talks from vaious students as a light-hearted introduction to the art of presenting!

The slides are available here:

Klaus Advanced Computing Building: Slides.
